lessons.title: Question: Importing React
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which statement imports React into our app?

import React from "react"import "react"import from "react"

import React from "react".

lessons.title: Example: Importing ReactDOM
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the import statement for React.

Make sure to type React.

lessons.title: Question: index.html
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which HTML tags do we need to include in index.html for this React app to work?

<div id="panel">...</div><div id="me">...</div><div id="main">...</div>

<div id="panel">...</div>.

lessons.title: Example: index.html II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the correct id to the div container inside the HTML to allow the React content to appear on the page.

Make sure to type id="root".

lessons.title: Question: Embedded Expressions
lessons.interactiveContent:
What do we use embedded expressions for?

To insert JSX elements into other elementsTo create a new JSX elementTo create padding between visual elements

To insert JSX elements into other elements.

lessons.title: Example: Embedded Expression
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use embedded expressions to ensure that name and dob are rendered inside the div.

Make sure to pick { followed by name and then }, {, dob, }.

lessons.title: Example: Attributes
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code src={url} inside the image element to ensure the image is displayed correctly.

Make sure to type src={url}.

lessons.title: a - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Return a paragraph displaying Welcome.

React converts JSX into real HTML, so your browser can understand and display it just like normal HTML.

Make sure to pick return followed by <p> and then Welcome, </p>.

lessons.title: Lesson #16 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the building block of a React app called?

ComponentsFunctionsClasses

Make sure to pick Components.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import the default exported Greeting component and the named export Footer.

Make sure to pick Greeting followed by { and then Footer, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make this a default exported component.

Make sure to type default.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What should each React component file begin with?

An import statement for ReactA CSS importA function callA return statement

An import statement for React.

lessons.title: Lesson #18 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the output of this code?

It displays What will I display? in an h1 tagIt displays What will I display? in an p tagIt displays What will I display? in an span tag

It displays What will I display? in an h1 tag.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a functional component that displays a list of items.

Make sure to pick const followed by List and then =, (, ), =>, {, }, ;.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the purpose of the export default statement?

To make the component accessible in other filesTo compile the componentTo import styles for the componentTo run the component immediately

To make the component accessible in other files.

lessons.title: Lesson #15 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a div element with an id property set to "root" to serve as the container for our React code.

Make sure to pick <div id="root">, followed by </div>.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of these paths correctly imports a component named Header from the same directory?

import Header from "./Header";import Header from "../Header";import Header from "Header";import Header from "/Header";

import Header from "./Header";.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Combine the default Content component import with a named export Sidebar.

Make sure to pick export, followed by export, and finally default.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does ./ signify when importing a component?

The current directoryThe root directoryThe parent directoryAn external library

The current directory.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the Main component the default export.

Make sure to pick export, followed by default.

lessons.title: a - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to make the HobbyComponent work as expected.

Make sure to type return.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the correct tag name for a component in React?

<ComponentName /><componentName /><Component-Name /><component_name />

<ComponentName />.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
What statement correctly imports a React component from another file?

import App from "./App"require("./App")include "./App"using App from "./App"

import App from "./App".

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following is a rule for rendering React components?

Components must start with a capital letterComponents should start with a lowercase letterComponents are written without any letter case preferenceComponents must start with a number

Components must start with a capital letter.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will happen if we import only one of the named components like this?

Only the Ghost component will be renderedBoth Ghost and Snake components will be renderedAn error occurs for importing SnakeThe app will not render

Only the Ghost component will be rendered.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use named exports to create multiple components in a single file.

Make sure to pick export followed by Character and then export, Setting.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import the Villain component and render it inside the App.

Make sure to pick import followed by Villain and then from, "./Villain", <Villain />.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the correct way to import the default exported Navbar component from Navbar.jsx?

import Navbar from "./Navbar";import { Navbar } from "./Navbar";import "./Navbar";import { default as Navbar } from "./Navbar";

import Navbar from "./Navbar";.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is necessary to import a React component from a different file and use it?

Use the import statementDeclare the component as a global variableUse the require functionUse the component using a direct DOM manipulation

Use the import statement.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import the existing Hero component and render it multiple times within the App component.

Make sure to pick import followed by Hero and then from, "./Hero", <Hero />, <Hero />, <Hero />.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code so that both named exports from the file Cinema.jsx are imported and rendered correctly.

Make sure to pick { followed by Movie and then }, <Movie />.
